subject: Missing API: Assert.assertThat(boolean) or IsCollection.isEmpty()
msgSnippet: I just discovered that the hamcrest like API misses a nice method to assert the true-ness of boolean methods. Writing: assertThat(list.isEmpty(), is(true));
messageBody:
I just discovered that the hamcrest like API misses a nice method to
assert the true-ness of boolean methods.

Writing:

assertThat(list.isEmpty(), is(true));

feels less natural than:

assertThat(list.isEmpty());

or

assertThat(list, isEmpty());

Or am I overlooking some API?

Martijn
